events.text: Construct has functions?!??!?!?!?!? This is fabulous!!!! (Imagine me saying that in the fruitiest way possible)

events.title: LevelControl
events.description: This segment of code will decide which level you are on. Level 0 is the tutorial.

events.title: ShipControl
events.description: Rule set for the ship's control scheme.

parameters.text: "Warning: Weapons overloaded. Please allow recharge."

actions.text: Yep, of course I wrote all this delicous spaghetti before finding out that there was a much easier way to do all of it. Game development is a learning experience I guess........
No, I can't spell delicouse. I won't even let autocorrect fix me. We are not friends.

And of course, I'm going to leave the spaghetti here until the next branch. It would be way too difficult to retrofit all the code now. Our deadline is SWIFTLY approaching and we don't have that much time.

parameters.text: "Hello? Hello? God dammit, they’ve passed out. Alright, take them out of there."
"No, no, their vitals are normal."
"Oh well keep them in there! Are you there, Private? What’s going on?"
"It’s possible they can’t talk while their brain is linked to the system. We haven’t quite ironed out the BCI yet."
"Can they hear me?"
"I don’t know, just tell them to do something. Maybe they’ll listen."
"You don’t listen when I tell you to do something. What makes you so sure they’re different?"
"Private, if you’re there, engage autolaunch."
"That’s the only thing on the screen."
"Press autolaunch."
"Are you sure they’re awake?"
"Yeah, pretty sure…"
"Pretty sure?"
"What do you want from me?"
"A yes or no would be nice!"
"Well, major, sometimes you can’t be that certain"
"Are you talking back to me, Doctor!?"
"That’s how fucking conversation works, Major. Would you rather I say nothing?"
"I WOULD RATHER GET A YES OR NO!"
"YES! HE’S FUCKING AWAKE!"
"Thank you..."
"Jesus."
"Sorry for yelling."
"So anyway, private, did you push autolaunch yet?"
"You didn’t? Why do we even train these kids?"

parameters: "Alright, good, you’ve proven that you can follow instructions and you’ve proven that you can push a button."
"So, now that you’ve gotten your Ing-875 started up, allow me to introduce myself. You can call me Major General Stanley. I’ll be showing you the ropes of space combat today."
"Whenever you’re ready, press “launch now” on your screen."

parameters.text: "Ok. Now that you’re behind the wheel, I’ll take control remotely and show you how to fly."
"You can’t take remote control with the 875 series."
"The 700s could..."
"Well maybe we could afford more 700’s if we had the budget but"
"Doctor, if you have a complaint about the budget, then take it up with the Admiral. But don’t get on my ass about it."
"Ok. I’ll just tell you what to do. To move right, you have to think about moving right."
"Need some help visualizing? Imagine pressing the right arrow key or D key on a computer keyboard."
"Excellent work, Private. Now try pressing the left arrow key or the A key on your keyboard."
"You’re better than most of our recruits, I must say. Now to move forward or decelerate, press the W and S, or Up and Down keys or your keyboard."
"Great job following directions, Private. You’re a natural! Now, press space to fire your weapons."
"You might have noticed that the weapons are switched off right now. They use a lot of energy. They’ll be activated when you switch to combat configuration."

parameters: "In the meantime private. That's our training for today. If you want to play around with the ship a bit that's fine."

events.title: Level1
events.description: First level. Time to fight Tekototamat

parameters: "Major, could you come and take a look at this?"
"Sensors have picked up an signature, it’s a big one too."
"Ohhh shit. Do we have any fighters on standby?"
"Ok, Private. We have an alien closing in on you, it’ll be there in no time and you’re going to have to kill it yourself. You are physically incapable of objecting."
"One more thing I forgot to mention… Do you see that clock on your head-up display? Pay attention to that. "
"Once we switch you to combat configuration, you’ll only have about five minutes to neutralize the target. Good luck, private."
"Alright I’m back. Did you finish the incident report yet? Maybe we can still get some insurance money for that awful ship."
"Oh shit! They did? Did you switch their ship to life support config yet?"

events.title: Reset
events.description: (Hopefully) Restarts the game when you get killed. But isn't currently working.
